verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 1:1
verses.text: The misfortunes of the Book of Balaam, son of Beor. A divine seer was he.

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 1:2
verses.text: The gods came to him at night. And he beheld a vision in accordance with El's utterance. They said to Balaam, son of Beor:

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 1:5
verses.text: Balaam arose on the morrow;

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 1:6
verses.text: And for two days he fasted and wept bitterly.

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 1:7
verses.text: Then he said to them:

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 1:8
verses.text: The Shaddai gods have established a council,

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 1:9
verses.text: So that you instill dread in dense darkness.

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 1:10
verses.text: It shall be that the swift and crane will shriek insult to the eagle,

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 1:11
verses.text: The chicks of the heron, sparrow and cluster of eagles;

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 1:12
verses.text: Heed the admonition, adversaries of Sha[gar-and-IÅ¡tar]!

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 1:14
verses.text: To a perfumer of myrrh and a priestess.

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 1:15
verses.text: They heard incantations from afar

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 1:16
verses.text: And all beheld acts of distress.

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 1:17
verses.text: The piglet [drove out] the leopard

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 2:4
verses.text: .. a girl those who were used? to be saturated with love ...

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 2:5
verses.text: .. a blinded one and the whole moistened? soil? ...

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 2:6
verses.text: El satisfied himself with [lovemaking]

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 2:7
verses.text: A house where no traveler enters

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 2:8
verses.text: Worm rot from a grave.

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 2:9
verses.text: If it is for counsel, one will not counsel with you!

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 2:10
verses.text: From the bed they cover themselves with a wrap.

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 2:12
verses.text: all ... in their heart.

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 2:13
verses.text: There is no mercy when Death seizes an infant.

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 2:14
verses.text: The heart of the corpse is desolate

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 2:15
verses.text: "The quest of a king becomes his moth (rot),

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 2:16
verses.text: Your quest is distant from you.

verses.name: The Balaam Inscription 2:17
verses.text: And [banned] from pronouncing words of execration.
